009package Ch13_Color_Images;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
017import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
018import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
019
020import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * ImageJ plugin, increases the brightness of a RGB color image by 10 units (each color component) without bit
025 * operations (Version 2). See Sec. 13.1 (Prog. 13.2) of [1] for details.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
029 * (2022).
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 */
034public class Brighten_Rgb_2 implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
035        
036        private static int BrightnessDelta = 10;        // increase by 10 units
037        static final int R = 0, G = 1, B = 2;           // component indices
038
039        /**
040         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
041         */
042        public Brighten_Rgb_2() {
043                if (noCurrentImage()) {
044                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Flower);
045                }
046        }
047
048        @Override
049        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
050                return DOES_RGB;        // this plugin works on RGB images 
051        }
052        
053        @Override
054        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
055                if (!runDialog()) {
056                        return;
057                }
058
059                //make sure image is of type ColorProcessor
060                ColorProcessor cp = (ColorProcessor) ip; 
061                int[] RGB = new int[3];
062
063                for (int v = 0; v < cp.getHeight(); v++) {
064                        for (int u = 0; u < cp.getWidth(); u++) {
065                                cp.getPixel(u, v, RGB); 
066                                // RGB[R] = Math.min(RGB[R] + BrightnessDelta, 255);  // limit to 255
067                                // RGB[G] = Math.min(RGB[G] + BrightnessDelta, 255);
068                                // RGB[B] = Math.min(RGB[B] + BrightnessDelta, 255);
069
070                                RGB[R] = clamp(RGB[R] + BrightnessDelta);  // limit to 0,..,255
071                                RGB[G] = clamp(RGB[G] + BrightnessDelta);
072                                RGB[B] = clamp(RGB[B] + BrightnessDelta);
073                                cp.putPixel(u, v, RGB); 
074                        }
075                }
076        }
077
078        private int clamp(int val) {
079                if (val < 0) return 0;
080                if (val > 255) return 255;
081                return val;
082        }
083
084        private boolean runDialog() {
085                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
086                gd.addHelp(getJavaDocUrl());
087                gd.addNumericField("Brightness delta", BrightnessDelta, 0);
088
089                gd.showDialog();
090                if(gd.wasCanceled())
091                        return false;
092
093                BrightnessDelta = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
094                return true;
095        }
096}
